intro: Polygala calcarea subsp. amara, commonly known as the bitter milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, calcareous soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. This species is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
